On Wednesday, April 04, 2012 7:56 PM, Barry Norton wrote:

> Have you noticed that still not a word has been said
> here about RDF as a data model (let alone the 'Semantics'
> approach to schemas)?

Yes, and that's the dilemma. You can't talk about RDF without these negative
connotations. This is the very reason why we tried really hard to "hide" RDF
as much as possible in the JSON-LD spec [1]. We went even so far to formally
define what define Linked Data is in the context of JSON-LD [2].


> RDF can, and does, 'deal with the ambiguity of the Web'. 
> Witness OpenGraph Protocol, and RDF-based solutions using it
> (despite the IR/NIR ambiguity).
>
> This whole range14 thing is just a red herring.

I agree and there are numerous examples showing that.. but unfortunately the
RDF/Linked Data community doesn't really communicate that - range14 actually
communicates quite the opposite.

Let's once for all stop discussing these things and move on and bring the
REST community and the Linked Data community together. I'm sure there are
more common interests than disagreements and that both communities would
benefit a lot from each other.


[1] http://json-ld.org/spec/latest/json-ld-syntax/
[2] http://json-ld.org/requirements/latest/#linked-data



--
Markus Lanthaler
